issue.title: Force Torque sensor does not give correct results for torque and is extremely noisy

content.raw: @jespersmith: You're right about the comment in JointWrench.hh, that the force torque is incorrectly stated as relative to Link's center of mass.  In the use case in [GetForceTorque](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/6193273ed4a74ba64f7fd25b02c37c20896775a5/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEJoint.cc?at=force_torque_fix_1.6#cl-898), the returned JointWrench is about the joint frame.  The associated [unit test](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/6193273ed4a74ba64f7fd25b02c37c20896775a5/gazebo/physics/ode/ODEJoint_TEST.cc?at=force_torque_fix_1.6#cl-35) should reflect that, unless I've made some error in the code.  Please confirm.  Thanks.
